title: AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic
goal: Learn about AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic and understand: MAIN CONCEPTS.
actions:
Read: Policy evaluation logic - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_policies_evaluation-logic.html (5 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • MAIN CONCEPTS
   • AWS IAM policy evaluation involves multiple policy types: identity-based policies, resource-based policies, permissions boundaries, and AWS Organizations policies (SCPs and RCPs).
   • AWS evaluates requests by authenticating the principal, processing the request context, and then applying policy evaluation logic to allow or deny access.
Practice: Review a sample AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic policy and identify what it allows/denies (15 min)
Self-test: Without looking at notes, explain AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic to an imaginary coworker in 2-3 sentences (5 min)
completion_check: Can explain AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic in your own words and completed the practice exercise
subdomain: AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic
subdomains_covered: AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic

title: AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials
goal: Learn about AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials and understand: MAIN CONCEPTS.
actions:
Read: IAM roles - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles.html (12 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • MAIN CONCEPTS
   • IAM roles are AWS identities with specific permissions, designed to be assumed temporarily by users, applications, or services rather than tied to a single individual.
   • Roles do not have long-term credentials; instead, assuming a role provides temporary security credentials via AWS Security Token Service (STS).
Practice: Follow along with a basic AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials configuration example (15 min)
Self-test: Without looking at notes, explain AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials to an imaginary coworker in 2-3 sentences (5 min)
completion_check: Can explain AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials in your own words and completed the practice exercise
subdomain: AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials
subdomains_covered: AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials

title: AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Primitives and Misconfigurations
goal: Learn about AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Primitives and Misconfigurations and understand: MAIN CONCEPTS.
actions:
Read: Permissions boundaries for IAM entities - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/access_policies_boundaries.html (10 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • MAIN CONCEPTS
   • Permissions boundaries in AWS IAM define the maximum permissions an IAM user or role can have, acting as a ceiling on allowed actions regardless of identity-based policies.
   • Effective permissions for an IAM entity are the intersection of identity-based policies, permissions boundaries, resource-based policies, AWS Organizations SCPs, and session policies.
Practice: Review a sample AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Primitives and Misconfigurations policy and identify what it allows/denies (15 min)
Self-test: Without looking at notes, explain AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Primitives and Misconfigurations to an imaginary coworker in 2-3 sentences (5 min)
completion_check: Can explain AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Primitives and Misconfigurations in your own words and completed the practice exercise

title: AWS IAM Resource-Based Policies and Cross-Account Access
goal: Learn about AWS IAM Resource-Based Policies and Cross-Account Access and understand: MAIN CONCEPTS.
actions:
Read: IAM tutorial: Delegate access across AWS accounts using IAM roles - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/tutorial_cross-account-with-roles.html (11 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • MAIN CONCEPTS
   • Cross-account access in AWS allows users in one AWS account (Originating) to access resources in another account (Destination) without creating separate IAM users in each account.
   • IAM roles enable delegation of permissions across AWS accounts by establishing trust relationships and defining specific permissions.

title: Bucket Policies and Public Access Controls in Object Storage
goal: Learn about Bucket Policies and Public Access Controls in Object Storage and understand: MAIN CONCEPTS.
actions:
Read: Blocking public access to your Amazon S3 storage - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/access-control-block-public-access.html (11 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • MAIN CONCEPTS
   • Public access can be granted through ACLs, bucket policies, access point policies, or object permissions, and Block Public Access prevents public access granted by these mechanisms.
   • Organization-level Block Public Access policies propagate to member accounts and override account-level settings, ensuring centralized, consistent enforcement.

goal: Learn about Object-Level Permissions and ACL Abuse in Object Storage and understand: MAIN CONCEPTS.
actions:
Read: Access control list (ACL) overview - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/acl-overview.html (11 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • MAIN CONCEPTS
   • Amazon S3 Access Control Lists (ACLs) manage access permissions at the bucket and object level by specifying which AWS accounts or predefined groups (grantees) have what type of access.
   • ACLs are attached as subresources to buckets and objects, defining access rights such as READ, WRITE, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP.
